summary: Last warning or error in output is truncated

comments.content:
The last error or warning statement written to the output appears to be getting truncated. It's causing a problem for my error / warning parser.

To reproduce, create a file called test.js and add the following content to it:

---------------
alert(foo);
alert(bar);
---------------

When compiled, the output looks like this:

---------------
>java -jar compiler.jar --warning_level VERBOSE --js test.js
test.js:1: ERROR - variable foo is undefined
alert(foo);
      ^

test.js:2: ERROR - variable bar is undefined

2 error(s), 0 warning(s)
---------------

If you look at the last error includes neither the line the error occurred on nor the column-indicating caret. This happens with warnings as well.

Tested against r1257 committed 2011-07-11 11:11:32 -0700.

I tried and got the correct warning information:

test.js:1: ERROR - variable foo is undefined
alert(foo);
      ^

test.js:2: ERROR - variable bar is undefined
alert(bar);
      ^

2 error(s), 0 warning(s)

Could you please try again and let me know if the error still occurs.

This is still happening for me as of r1261 with a stock build (no patches) on Windows 7 SP1.

>svn up
...

>ant clean
...

>ant
...

[created test.js file, as above]

>java -jar compiler.jar --warning_level VERBOSE --js test.js
test.js:1: ERROR - variable foo is undefined
alert(foo);
      ^

test.js:2: ERROR - variable bar is undefined

2 error(s), 0 warning(s)

>java -version
java version "1.6.0_24"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_24-b07)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 19.1-b02, mixed mode)
This doesn't appear to be a new issue at least. I can reproduce this in my environment going back to at least r500.

Another run against r1261, this time with two input files. It looks like it's cutting off the last error / warning for each input perhaps.

>java -jar compiler.jar --warning_level VERBOSE --js test2.js --js test.js
test.js:1: ERROR - variable foo is undefined
alert(foo);
      ^

test.js:2: ERROR - variable bar is undefined

test2.js:1: ERROR - variable foo2 is undefined
alert(foo2);
      ^

test2.js:2: ERROR - variable bar2 is undefined

4 error(s), 0 warning(s)

I'm able to reproduce this on two other systems as well.


Windows 7 SP1
>java -version
java version "1.6.0_26"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_26-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 20.1-b02, mixed mode, sharing)

Windows Vista Business SP2
>java -version
java version "1.6.0_22"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_22-b04)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 17.1-b03, mixed mode)


When building and running in Linux w/ Java 1.6.0_15 however, it seems to work. It may be strictly a Windows problem.
I can reproduce the problem in windows. I think the simplest workaround solution is to add a carriage return in the end of each input file.
maybe the output stream isn't being flushed properly?
It's fixed and will come with the next release.
This issue was closed by revision r1373.
Issue 414 has been merged into this issue.
